text: We'll have some version of actually impactful AI agents before the end of 2025
reasoning: Test time compute paradigm of o1 series makes this even more likely. 'Meaningfully impact our lives' is vague, but we'll know it when we see it.

evidence.note: OpenAI released Operator agent -- evidence mixed, is an agent, utility extremely limited
OpenAI released Deep Resarch agent -- evidence strong, is an agent, utility is strong

text: The first industry that will be hugely disrupted is customer support agents in call centers
reasoning: At least one firm will do major layoffs in this area and replace/supplement workers with AI systems. Customer satisfaction will go up not down.

evidence.note: Klarna is re-hiring after making a big todo about going AI first, not yet definitive because its only May, but some negative evidence that customer support agents aren't ready for prime time.  However, I think there's still a world of opportunity here and its unclear to me how much better they need to be.

text: At least one, but certainly not the majority of major tech companies dramatically changes hiring methodology in light of AI
reasoning: For example, allowing the use of models during an interview, but having higher expectations

evidence.note: No major announcements yet, checking in at halfway point

text: Peak AI anxiety will occur in 2026 or 2027 (not 2025)
reasoning: Normal people will become increasingly concerned about whether it will impact their industry and jobs

text: By 2026 AI will be pervasive enough that the predominant way of using AI will not be through chat/co-pilots
reasoning: People will still think primarily of chat interfaces as AI, but this will begin shifting in 2025

text: Useful AI agents by September or October 2025
reasoning: Partial update to my 'useful agents' timeline based on Operator release

evidence.note: Operator released but underwhelming for demoed use cases

text: A jarring step-function level release sometime later this year
reasoning: Perhaps GPT5, perhaps an agent, maybe whatever is next from Anthropic

text: AI task horizon will reach ~32 hours (work week) with just 3 doublings in 2 years
reasoning: Based on METR data showing doubling of task length capability

text: There will be a widely popular AI generated song
reasoning: There's just too much latent creativity in the world that is enabled by these tools

text: AI video generation as creative hobby possible in 3-5 years

evidence.note: Sora is just not that good yet. Updated timelines from 2025 to 3-5 years

text: 10 doublings in AI task capability over next 2 years (90th percentile case)
reasoning: Doublings every 3 months for next year, then every 2 months following year. Would mean AI handles year-long tasks.

text: I will not be regularly using codex-cli in 3-6 months
reasoning: I just think there will be something better

text: AI will reach top 50 worldwide at competitive coding with next release
reasoning: o3/o4-mini already top 200. Similar 800 point jump would put next release at ~3500 ELO

text: UBI trials in the US will continue to show disappointing results
reasoning: Less optimistic than I once was about this as a path forward

text: Majority of current intermediate-level knowledge work will be automatable
reasoning: 15th-85th percentile understanding will be increasingly done by AI
